sentence: Tuesday headlines include: Apple making a big announcement, Amazon cutting Fire phone prices, eBay's PayPal unit to start taking bitcoins, Home Depot confirming the widely reported data breach and General Motors recalling thousands of cars in China.
Consumer electronics firm Apple ( AAPL ) has a big presentation scheduled for this afternoon.
The company is expected to reveal the latest generation of the iPhone, which is expected to be larger than the current model.

The new iPhone is also expected to include a near-field communications chip, which, when combined with an e-wallet, could allow consumers to use their phones to pay for things at brick-and-mortar retailers.
In a seemingly related move, online retailer Amazon ( AMZN ) cut the price of its Fire smartphone on Monday.
The 32 gigabyte version will now cost 99 cents with a two-year AT&T ( T ) contract, while the 64-gigabyte version will cost $99.
The phones previously cost $199 and $299 respectively.
Staying in the online retail space, PayPal, the payment arm of eBay ( EBAY ) will start allowing transactions that use bitcoin .
PayPal's Braintree unit will start allowing startup clients like Uber, Stubhub and Airbnb to accept the virtual currency.
Home-improvement retailer Home Depot ( HD ) confirmed on Monday that its payments systems have been breached and the theft of data could affect customers in stores in the U.S. and Canada.
The problem reportedly dates back to April and is said to have affected all or nearly all of the company's 2,200 stores.

A day after news circulated that it wants to make semi-autonomous cars, automaker General Motors' (GM) largest joint venture in China is recalling more than 38,000 Cadillac sedans in China due to a problem with the software that controls the brakes.
The Cadillac XTS vehicles effected by the recall were made between October 2012 and July 2014.
According to a Chinese safety watchdog, the problem could prevent the cars from accelerating properly.

This article was originally published on MarketIntelligeneCenter.com
